title: The Wolfe makes your laptop VR-ready on the cheap – and it's this week's featured Kickstarter | Trusted Reviews
description: ![the wolfemain]()The $399 (£302) early birds are sold out, but you can pick one up for $449(£340), or $599 (£453) for the Wolfe Pro. That’s a hell of a lot cheaper thansome of the top-end gaming laptops and PCs you’ll need to invest in if youwant to run the [Oculus Rift](https://www.trustedreviews.com/oculus-rift-review) or [HTC Vive](https://www.trustedreviews.com/htc-vive-review).Shipping will start in March (or February for anyone lucky enough to havenabbed an early bird).## And one to avoid this week…[Pear Inc. Start-up Company](https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/pear-inc-startup-company#/). Does that logo look familiar? We thought so. Pear’s mottois: “The only thing that is permanent if [sic] change. Our focus is to createtools for the mind that advance human kind.” Such as? It doesn’t say. And whathas it done in the past? Again, there’s no mention.We assume it’s a joke. But even so, it looks like a lawsuit waiting to happen.   **  Watch The Refresh: The best tech gossip and reviews every week  ******Will you be investing in the Wolfe? Let us know in the comments.
